snippet: New books describe stories of “the city’s first great civic enterprise,” recycled shuls in the boroughs outside Manhattan, and high school football.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books The Greatest Grid: The Master Plan of Manhattan 1811-2011, edited by Hilary Ballon, The Lost Synagogues of Brooklyn and The Lost Synagogues of the Bronx and Queens by Ellen Levitt, and Thanksgiving 1959 by Jay Price.
lead_paragraph: New books describe stories of “the city’s first great civic enterprise,” recycled shuls in the boroughs outside Manhattan, and high school football.

headline.seo: Books on an Enduring Grid, Lost Synagogues and a 1959 Tale
headline.main: A Grid, Lost Synagogues and a 1959 Tale
headline.print_headline: A Grid, Lost Synagogues and a 1959 Tale
